messages.content: How do I install ComfyUI Vextra Nodes?

1. Install [ComfyUI](https://github.com/comfyanonymous/ComfyUI). 2. Clone the repository in the ```custom_nodes``` folder inside your ComfyUI installation or download as zip and unzip the contents to ```custom_nodes/ComfyUI-Vextra-Nodes```. 3. Start/restart ComfyUI.
What is the Pixel Sort node in ComfyUI Vextra Nodes?
Pixel Sort is a custom node for ComfyUI that provides a pixel sorting effect by [satyarth](https://github.com/satyarth/pixelsort). It installs the pixelsort module upon installation.
What is the Swap Color Mode (Black & White) node in ComfyUI Vextra Nodes?

Swap Color Mode (Black & White) is a custom node that swaps the color mode to luminescence or single channel. It can be useful for creating masks or making images black & white. It is also helpful when changing RGB modes.
What does the Solid Color node in ComfyUI Vextra Nodes do?
The Solid Color node generates an empty solid color image with options for color, size, and batch size.
How can I add text to an image in ComfyUI Vextra Nodes?
You can use the Add Text To Image node to supply the path to a .ttf file and add text to an image input. It has options for anchor placement, rotation, color, and more.
What node in ComfyUI Vextra Nodes allows me to play sound during execution?
The Play Sound node allows you to play sound during execution.
What does the Prettify Prompt (PromptGen) node in ComfyUI Vextra Nodes do?
The Prettify Prompt (PromptGen) node uses the gpt2 AI model to prettify your prompt.
What is the purpose of the Generate Noise node in ComfyUI Vextra Nodes?
The Generate Noise node generates various noises to use in masks or blending.
What does the Flatten Colors node in ComfyUI Vextra Nodes do?
The Flatten Colors node flattens the colors of an image to a variable amount of colors.
